latestVersion.termsOfUse:
I request access to DATA of University Hospital Zurich (USZ) and I agree to the following:  This agreement (hereinafter referred to as “Agreement”) is made and entered by and between: USZ and RECIPIENT Hereinafter jointly referred to as “Parties” and individually as “Party”; WHEREAS USZ is the exclusive owner of the DATA. RECIPIENT, hereinafter referred to as “RECIPIENT SCIENTIST”, has requested USZ, through Dr. Qing Zhong and Prof. Peter Wild, hereinafter referred to as “UNIVERSITY'S SCIENTIST”, to provide RECIPIENT SCIENTIST with the DATA for research use by RECIPIENT SCIENTIST. USZ is willing, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, to provide the DATA to RECIPIENT SCIENTIST. 

I. Definitions 
1. DATA: The data being transferred under this Agreement. 
2. RESULTS: All results arising from performing the research. 

II. Terms and Conditions of this Agreement
1. The DATA provided is and remains the property of USZ and is made available as a service to the research community. 
2. The RECIPIENT SCIENTIST agrees that the DATA: (a) is to be used only for academic purposes; (b) will not be used for commercial purposes and (c) will not be transferred to a third party. 
3. RECIPIENT’S SCIENTIST shall keep UNIVERSITY’S SCIENTIST informed of the RESULTS and cite the DATA and the related publication. Papers, book chapters, books, posters, oral presentations, and all other printed and digital presentations of results derived from the DATA should contain the following wording in the acknowledgments section: DATA were provided by the Department of Pathology and Molecular Pathology, University Hospital Zurich (Dr. Qing Zhong and Prof. Peter Wild). 
4. It is expressly understood that USZ does not make any warranties regarding the DATA and specifically does not warrant or guarantee that the DATA will be accurate, be merchantable or useful for any particular purpose. USZ cannot and shall not be held liable for any claims or damages by applicant or any third party, in connection with or as a result of using the DATA. 
5. RECIPIENT SCIENTIST agrees in its use of the DATA to comply with all applicable international and national laws, statutes, regulations and guidelines, especially all laws, statutes and regulations concerning the protection of data. RECIPIENT SCIENTIST shall further not carry out any procedures with the DATA (linking, comparison, processing) with which the identity of the donor could be derived. 
6. This Agreement represents this entire Agreement among the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, and may only be altered or amended by an instrument in writing signed by all of the Parties.
7. If any portion of this Agreement is in violation of any applicable regulation, or is unenforceable or void for any reason whatsoever, such portion will be inoperative and the remainder of this Agreement will be binding upon the Parties.

fields.value: Clinical and survival data of 424 prostate cancer patients

dsDescriptionValue.value: The survival data exhibit a median follow-up of 95 months and a maximum of 167 months for the 339 RPE samples with additional clinico-pathological, immunological and molecular data, including patient age at diagnosis, body mass index, Gleason score, tumour stage, nodal status, surgical margin status, PSA at diagnosis, PTEN FISH analyses, SPOP mutation, ERG break-apart FISH, PTEN immunoreactivity, and expert annotations of FISH PTEN/CEP10 signals with manual cell nuclei counting.
